references.paper_title: Learning transferable visual models from natural language supervision
references.reason: This paper introduces the foundational CLIP model, which is crucial to many text-to-image generation techniques and is directly used in this paper's evaluation methodology.
This paper introduces the core denoising diffusion probabilistic model, the underlying architecture of many modern text-to-image models including those used and improved by this paper.

references.paper_title: An image is worth one word: Personalizing text-to-image generation using textual inversion
references.reason: This paper introduces Textual Inversion, a key personalization technique that is augmented and improved upon in this paper, making it a foundational work for the presented method.

references.paper_title: DreamBooth: Fine tuning text-to-image diffusion models for subject-driven generation
references.reason: This paper introduces DreamBooth, a popular and relevant personalization method which is one of the baselines used and improved upon in this paper, thus being highly important to the context.
This paper introduces the Delta Denoising Score (DDS) framework, which is a key component of this paper's proposed method, making it highly important to the core method.
